definition: hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)

sentences.english: Do not say the public difficult to measure, leader first contain an enthusiastic heart.
sentences.chinese: 不要说人心难测，领导者首先要有一颗热诚的心。

sentences.english: It is real hard to guess someone's inner, so don't be regret for making some decisions.
sentences.chinese: 人心难测阿，所有的决定你一旦作出，请别去后悔。

sentences.english: He did not want to take risks, but people unpredictable, but also everywhere beware.
sentences.chinese: 不用想他那样冒险，但是人心难测，也要处处提防。

definition: there is no knowing what is in a man's heart (idiom)
one may know a person for a long time without understanding his true nature (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 ren2 zhi1 mian4 bu4 zhi1 xin1

definition: the men of today are sadly degenerated (idiom)
the ways of the world/the morals of the time
lit. easy to dodge the spear in the open, hard to avoid a stab in the dark (idiom); it is hard to guard against secret conspiracies
pinyin: ming2 qiang1 yi4 duo3 , an4 jian4 nan2 fang2

definition: being close to the sovereign can be as perilous as lying with a tiger (idiom)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
a man who is never content is like a snake trying to swallow an elephant (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 xin1 bu4 zu2 she2 tun1 xiang4

definition: lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
